intro: Picea excelsa f. laticeps, commonly known as the broad-crowned fir, is a botanical variant of the white spruce. It is characterized by its wide, spreading crown and elongated, slender needles. This form typically grows in high-altitude regions, where it thrives in cool, moist climates. Its cones are cylindrical and often remain attached to the branches for an extended period. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in mountainous ecosystems.
